comments.body:
I think this should be 

```
export = StateMachine;
```
@basarat It appears to be correct with StateMachineStatic to me.

@vvakame @balassy this works here since we do not have `callable` signatures on the interface. Those would give a typescript error. You can see an isolated example of the issue here: https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/2356

would prefer if it was `export = StateMachine` for consistency (and not being surprising) in the meantime :)
`export = Interface` not useful in typescript next : https://github.com/borisyankov/DefinitelyTyped/issues/1929

For record of DT team members. @balassy can ignore this comment.

I used to disagree with adding these for amd only packages since `"state-machine"` is a name that needs to be configured in your requirejs config. 

But I think we should start adding these since it makes it easier for people to use this js module if no shim is required i.e. the js module does a valid amd export on its own : https://github.com/jakesgordon/javascript-state-machine/blob/master/state-machine.js#L195

Of course the user will need to setup the `path` name to match but I think that is trivial to figure out from the definition file.
